metadata.title: CVE-2019-13616 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) through 1.2.15 and 2.x through 2.0.9 has a heap-based buffer over-read in BlitNtoN in video/SDL_blit_N.c when called from SDL_SoftBlit in video/SDL_blit.c. USN-4238-1 addressed serveral vulnerabilities in SDL_image. This update provides the corresponding fixes for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl1.2debian - 1.2.15+dfsg2-5
No subscription required

libsdl2-2.0-0 - 2.0.10+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libsdl2-tests - 2.0.10+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.5+dfsg1-2
libsdl2-image-tests - 2.0.5+dfsg1-2
No subscription required

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl1.2 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.15+dfsg2-5').
libsdl2 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.10+dfsg1-1ubuntu1').
libsdl2-image package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.5+dfsg1-2').
sdl-image1.2 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-12').
